property.description: If selected code for parameter checking is included in the build.

constraint.display: Unique name required for each instance
Add at least one channel configuration
Calibration End Interrupt is required if any channel is configured in differential mode.

requires.display: Add Configuration for Channel 0 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 1 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 2 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 3 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 4 [Optional, only if used]

property.description: Module name.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: In single scan mode, all channels are converted once per start trigger, and conversion stops after all enabled channels are scanned. In continuous scan mode, conversion starts after a start trigger, then continues until stopped in software.
Select 24-bit or 16-bit resolution.
Select left or right alignment.

Select conversion start trigger. Conversion can be started in software, or conversion can be started when a hardware event occurs if the hardware event is linked to the SDADC peripheral using the ELC API.
Vref can be source internally and output on the SBIAS pin, or Vref can be input from VREFI.
Select Vref voltage. If Vref is input externally, the voltage on VREFI must match the voltage selected within 3%.
Calibration is required for all channels configured for differential input. Internal calibration is performed automatically during open for these channels unless it is disabled here.
Enter the name of the callback function to be called when conversion completes or a scan ends.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: [Required] Select the interrupt priority for the conversion end interrupt.
[Optional] Select the interrupt priority for the scan end interrupt.
[Optional] Select the interrupt priority for the calibration end interrupt.

module.declarations: #if ${module.driver.adc.scan_end_ipl} != BSP_IRQ_DISABLED #if !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_${module.driver.adc.name}) && !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_SDADC${module.driver.adc.unit}) SSP_VECTOR_DEFINE_CHAN(sdadc_scanend_isr, SDADC, SCANEND, ${module.driver.adc.unit}); #endif #endif #if ${module.driver.adc.conversion_end_ipl} != BSP_IRQ_DISABLED #if !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_${module.driver.adc.name}) && !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_SDADC${module.driver.adc.unit}) SSP_VECTOR_DEFINE_CHAN(sdadc_adi_isr, SDADC, ADI, ${module.driver.adc.unit}); #endif #endif #if ${module.driver.adc.calibration_end_ipl} != BSP_IRQ_DISABLED #if !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_${module.driver.adc.name}) && !defined(SSP_SUPPRESS_ISR_SDADC${module.driver.adc.unit}) SSP_VECTOR_DEFINE_CHAN(sdadc_caliend_isr, SDADC, CALIEND, ${module.driver.adc.unit}); #endif #endif sdadc_instance_ctrl_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_ctrl; const adc_on_sdadc_cfg_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg_extend = { .calibration_end_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.calibration_end_ipl}, .conversion_end_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.conversion_end_ipl}, .vref_src = ${module.driver.adc.vref_src}, .vref_voltage = ${module.driver.adc.vref_voltage}, .skip_internal_calibration = ${module.driver.adc.skip_internal_calibration}, #define SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED (1) #if (SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel0::module.driver.adc.channel}) .p_channel_cfgs[0] = NULL, #else .p_channel_cfgs[0] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg0, #endif #if (SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel1::module.driver.adc.channel}) .p_channel_cfgs[1] = NULL, #else .p_channel_cfgs[1] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg1, #endif #if (SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel2::module.driver.adc.channel}) .p_channel_cfgs[2] = NULL, #else .p_channel_cfgs[2] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg2, #endif #if (SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel3::module.driver.adc.channel}) .p_channel_cfgs[3] = NULL, #else .p_channel_cfgs[3] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg3, #endif #if (SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel4::module.driver.adc.channel}) .p_channel_cfgs[4] = NULL, #else .p_channel_cfgs[4] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg4, #endif #undef SYNERGY_NOT_DEFINED }; const adc_cfg_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg = { .unit = ${module.driver.adc.unit}, .mode = ${module.driver.adc.mode}, .resolution = ${module.driver.adc.resolution}, .alignment = ${module.driver.adc.alignment}, .add_average_count = ADC_ADD_OFF, .clearing = ADC_CLEAR_AFTER_READ_OFF, .trigger = ${module.driver.adc.trigger}, .trigger_group_b = ADC_TRIGGER_SOFTWARE, .scan_end_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.scan_end_ipl}, .scan_end_b_ipl = 15U, .p_callback = ${module.driver.adc.p_callback}, .p_context = &${module.driver.adc.name}, .p_extend = &${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg_extend, }; /* Instance structure to use this module. */ const adc_instance_t ${module.driver.adc.name} = { .p_ctrl = &${module.driver.adc.name}_ctrl, .p_cfg = &${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg, .p_channel_cfg = NULL, .p_api = &g_adc_on_sdadc };

constraint.display: Unique channel required for each Channel configuration
For Single-Ended Input, Stage 1 Gain must be 1
For Single-Ended Input, Stage 2 Gain must be 1
For Single-Ended Input, Oversample Ratio must be 256

property.description: Specify the channel.
Select differential or single-ended input.
Select the gain for stage 1 of the PGA. Must be 1 for single-ended input.
Select the gain for stage 2 of the PGA. Must be 1 for single-ended input.
Select the oversampling ratio for the PGA. Must be 256 for single-ended input.
Select positive or negative polarity for single-ended input. VBIAS (1.0 V typical) is connected on the opposite input.
Select the number of conversions to average for each result. The ADC_EVENT_CONVERSION_END event occurs after each average, or after each individual conversion if averaging is disabled.

option.display: Do Not Average (Interrupt after Each Conversion)

property.display: Invert (Valid for Negative Single-Ended Input Only)
property.description: Select whether to invert negative single-ended input. When the result is inverted, the lowest measurable voltage gives a result of 0, and the highest measurable voltage gives a result of 2^resolution - 1.
Number of conversions on this channel before AUTOSCAN moves to the next channel. When all conversions of all channels are complete, the ADC_EVENT_SCAN_END event occurs.
